newsitem.title: RUSSIA: WEIGHTLIFTING-FIVE BELARUSSIANS FAIL DOPE TESTS.
newsitem.headline: WEIGHTLIFTING-FIVE BELARUSSIANS FAIL DOPE TESTS.

text.p: Five Belarussian weightlifters have tested positive for banned drugs, throwing into doubt the entire squad's participation in this week's European championships in Croatia, Belarus Weightlifting Federation sources said on Monday.
The five were named as Andrei Marchenko, Vladimir Khlud, Alexei Krushevich, Ruslan Doroshevich and Fyodor Mager. It was not immediately clear what substances had been found in their samples.
The sources said samples taken from the five would be subjected to further tests and the weightlifters could then face sanctions or fines.
Belarus is, with Russia, one of the world's great weightlifting powers, continuing where the Soviet Union left off.
Alexander Kurlovich, a double Olympic medallist in 1992 who took over as Belarus chief coach only a few months ago, himself suffered two doping suspensions in major world competitions.
Marchenko represents Belarus in the 76 kg class, Khlud in 91 kg, Mager at 108 kg and Krushevich and Doroshevich both lift in the over 108 kg category.
